author: National Bureau
text:
BJP MP and former cricketer Kirti Azad has questioned the party for serving a show-cause notice on him, saying his pursuance of the issue of corruption in the Delhi and District Cricket Association has no link to it and even Finance Minister Arun Jaitley cannot seek “the shield of party discipline” in this matter.

On Thursday, Mr. Azad made a point-by-point rebuttal of the charges in the notice slapped on him. He had been pursuing the issue of corruption in the DDCA for the past nine years “without any let-up” and was not once told by the BJP not to pursue it. He said that he had not “named Mr. Jaitley or any party person” in the issue and it was not the party’s assignment that Mr. Jaitley was carrying out as president of the DDCA.

Referring to previous BJP chiefs who had refrained from upbraiding him on the issue, he said, “All three respected party presidents also realised that cricket had no connection with our party activities and Mr. Jaitley’s role in DDCA was his own concern.” He did not name them.

“Not one office-bearer, apart from Mr. Jaitley, has reason to feel aggrieved by me or the cricketers’ [Bishan Singh Bedi and others] complaint of wrongdoings in DDCA,” he added.
title: I have not violated party discipline: Azad
